captions.text: Here's the plan.  You two will deftly infiltrate the glass fishbowl...

on the bottom of the heavily armored
carriers.   Then, sneakily insert...

these delicate little computer chips into
exactly the right slot...

in a huge rack of other tiny delicate little
computer chips.  Got it?

I'm confused.  If the point is to destroy
the carriers, why we going through all this trouble?

Shouldn't we just call the Hulk or something?
Yeah!  Didn't he like rip one to pieces already?

We make this work with just us.  We're all
we've got.
i'm ok Ill calling the Hulk up. Really!
Yeah, maybe get Iron man up here with a tank missile or something.
It's really no trouble!  He's already texted back. "On Hulk Way...
I said, We aren't calling in the Avengers!

Well this plan sounds extremely
dangerous...
Uh... I have the cool disguise-o-mesh technology...
You've had not this whole time?!
We've been hiding for our lives, woman!
And I would've gotten away with it too, if it weren't for you

Please stop all protocols and start dismantling the helicarriers.
And if you're Hydra...
uh...report to room 41, and don't bring your weapons...
Yeah we did!  Yeah none of us were really worried for you.

Yeah and he didn't.  I'm sensing  a pattern
here...
Coleson, Stark, Loki... You thought they were gone...
and then they werent. You should be careful with that.
Be careful coming back to life?  What does that even mean?
Didn't you fake your own death?
Well sure but I can get away with that sort of thing.

You keep dying in bringing people back
to life nobody will accept it one of you
Heh! None of us are gonna die!  That's silly talk.

Okay, well we'll see.  So what's next?  Just
cleaning up the rest Hydra.
Falcon offered to take care of it.
Me? I'm just gonna take it easy for a while. Go on some dates?
What is your deal with my love life? No I'm gonna find my best friend Bucky and convince him
he's not evil so we can be totes besties!
Yeah!  Stark, told me that's what you call best friends now.

Cross that off the list. Speaking of
Bucky, I have a question for you, Cap.
Remember that one time on the roof when, Captain America threw his mighty shield?
*sigh* Really? You bringing up my old theme song again?
Yes I've heard that,  All those who choose to oppose his shield must yield.
Well... did the Winter Soldier yield when you through your mighty shield?
He caught it with his super arm.
Or a brainwashed buddy with a robotic arm...
Then you don't necessarily have to yield!
If you'll excuse me, I need to start looking for Bucky.
Not the villain!  Not the villain!  Not the villain!

Hey kid, sorry your uncle turned out to be a
terrorist...
But a birthday promise is a birthday promise!
Jarvis I'm leaving.   You have to mingle, Sir.

title: How Captain America: The Winter Soldier Should Have Ended

comments.author: Mr. Tacos Taco Shop

comments.text:
This was one of the only Marvel movies so far that I didn't find fun to 
watch. Actually it was pretty boring. When watching a superhero movie, I 
kind of expect more. Once you establish that the Avengers are all part of 
the same cinematic universe, any stand alone hero movie is going to seem 
cheap. Why aren't the others there? Why aren't they reference? Another 
thing is that Captain America doesn't hold up as a fun superhero when you 
put him in present day settings. This movie just seemed to be a more amped 
up version of the new James Bond films or the Bourne trilogy. It just 
wasn't fun at all watching Capt being shepherded around by Black Widow 
searching for clues like god damned Scooby Doo. Unless they were fighting 
Black Widow pretty much held his hand thru the entire film. What fun is 
that?﻿
